wiki.summary: "Seven (Clean Ver.)" is the radio-friendly version of Jung Kook's debut solo single, "Seven", featuring American rapper Latto. Released on July 14, 2023, the clean version omits explicit lyrics, making it suitable for a wider audience. The track blends UK garage and pop elements, showcasing Jung Kook's versatility as a solo artist. The song's lyrics express a desire to spend all one's time with a lover, emphasizing themes of devotion and affection. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: "Seven (Clean Ver.)" is the radio-friendly version of Jung Kook's debut solo single, "Seven", featuring American rapper Latto. Released on July 14, 2023, the clean version omits explicit lyrics, making it suitable for a wider audience. The track blends UK garage and pop elements, showcasing Jung Kook's versatility as a solo artist. The song's lyrics express a desire to spend all one's time with a lover, emphasizing themes of devotion and affection. This achieved significant commercial success: Debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard Global 200 and Global Excl. U.S. charts, marking Jung Kook's first solo No. 1 on these rankings. Surpassed 2.5 billion streams on Spotify, setting a new record for a K-pop soloist. Charted at No. 42 on Melon's Top 100 in South Korea, indicating strong domestic popularity. The official music video for "Seven" features actress Han So-hee and presents a unique narrative. It portrays Jung Kook's character experiencing various events over seven days, culminating in a dramatic and romantic conclusion. "Seven (Clean Ver.)" is included in Jung Kook's debut solo album, Golden, released on November 3, 2023. The clean version of the song appears as the final track on the album. Read more on Last.fm.
